<!-- source-hash: 7f0107b38e16e8ff5e7588a1d278a6c4 -->
A data transfer object that encapsulates detailed audit log information for REST API responses, providing comprehensive log event details including metadata, content, and timestamps.

## Key Components

### Main Class
- **LogDetailsResponse** - Primary DTO class with Lombok annotations for automatic getter/setter generation and builder pattern support

### Core Fields
- **toolEventId** - Unique identifier for the tool event (e.g., "evt_123456")
- **eventType** - Classification of the event (e.g., "authentication_success")
- **ingestDay** - Date when the log was processed into the system
- **toolType** - Source tool that generated the log (e.g., "crowdstrike")
- **severity** - Log level indicator (INFO, WARN, ERROR, etc.)
- **userId/deviceId** - Associated user and device identifiers
- **summary/content** - Brief and full descriptions of the log event
- **timestamp** - UTC timestamp with ISO 8601 formatting

### Annotations
- **@Schema** annotations provide OpenAPI/Swagger documentation with examples
- **@JsonFormat** ensures consistent UTC timestamp serialization
- **@Data/@Builder** enable fluent object creation and property access

## Usage Example

```java
// Building a log details response
LogDetailsResponse response = LogDetailsResponse.builder()
    .toolEventId("evt_789012")
    .eventType("user_login")
    .ingestDay("2024-01-15")
    .toolType("active_directory")
    .severity("INFO")
    .userId("user123")
    .deviceId("device456")
    .summary("User successfully logged in")
    .content("User john.doe logged in from IP 192.168.1.100 at 09:30 AM")
    .timestamp(Instant.now())
    .build();

// Using in REST controller
@GetMapping("/logs/{eventId}")
public LogDetailsResponse getLogDetails(@PathVariable String eventId) {
    return auditService.getLogDetails(eventId);
}
```
